gauzy: a gauzy texture is soft and delicate with loose fibers that are barely visible.
a gauzy texture is often described as delicate and soft like a misty morning or a gentle summer breeze and often appears as a subtle layering or blending of fibers or materials.'
meshed: a meshed surface is created by a layer of particles or fibers intertwined with a cohesive binding material or adhesive.
meshed material appears to have a complex interlocking of different textures and colors.
cracked: cracked material often appears as fragile and fractured fragments with broken edges and surfaces.
cracked concrete appears as small fragments of broken stone within the larger structure.
stratified: a stratified texture is characterized by layers of different materials or colors.
stratified material has distinct layers of earthy components such as sand, silt, clay, and gravel.
scaly: scaly material often appears as thick, rough, and wavy patterns usually found in reptiles such as snakes and lizards and also in some types of fish and insects.
a scaly surface typically appears as a collection of overlapping scales or plates that are rough to the touch and can vary greatly in color depending on the species.
swirly: a swirly surface resembles a mixture of liquid and air with various colors and patterns forming randomly.
a swirly texture is like a marbled cake with random patterns of colors swirling together to create a unique design that changes shape as you look at it closely.'
perforated: perforated material appears as a thin strip of holes of varying size that penetrate the surface of a material.

a perforated surface looks like holes that go through a material and can be easily opened or removed 

.
pleated: a pleated surface is a type of folded material often found on clothing or upholstery that is typically made of fabric and has a distinctive layered appearance that resembles a series of accordion-like folds.
pleated material is a type of fabric characterized by folds in the material that are cut to a specific pattern and gathered at the top to form a puffed shape.
flecked: flecked material resembles unevenly colored fragments.
a flecked surface is characterized by small irregular particles or specks scattered throughout the area it is often found on clothing or textiles.
fibrous: fibrous material is usually found in the form of long thin threads or fibers that are soft to the touch and slightly flexible.
a fibrous texture is characterized by the presence of many slender fibers that give it a rough or bumpy appearance and often resembles a network of threads.
polka-dotted: a polka dot texture is characterized by small dots of color scattered randomly across a surface in a repeating pattern often with the dots of the same color connected to each other.
a polka-dotted surface has small dots arranged in a circular pattern evenly spaced around the edges.
chequered: the chequered material has horizontal stripes of different colors usually black and white, often used for coats, bags, or other fabric items.
a chequered texture is a repeating pattern of checkered or grid-like markings on a surface.
blotchy: a blotchy texture is often characterized by patches of uneven color or texture that can be felt to the touch.
a blotchy texture is often described as having patches of color that do not blend smoothly together.
stained: a stained texture is usually caused by dried blood or ink particles.
a stained texture appears as a mixture of discolorations of various colors or shades often resulting in a fuzzy or matted appearance.
crystalline: a crystalline texture is often characterized by its smooth, reflective, and transparent appearance.
crystalline materials appear as clear glassy or icy transparent structures.
porous: a porous surface appears as small holes or bumps on a surface, allowing air and water to pass through.
a porous texture is often visible as small holes or imperfections in an otherwise smooth surface.
banded: a banded surface is characterized by distinct bands or stripes of color usually gradating from light to dark.
a banded surface is a type of cliff or rock formation characterized by alternating layers of different colors and textures, often resembling a striped pattern.
lacelike: lens-like material appears as a thin flexible sheet of transparent plastic or glass coated with a thin layer of metal or other substances, allowing light to pass through while creating a smooth uniform surface.
lace-like material is often characterized by its smooth and shiny surface, usually with a slightly matte finish in the background to emphasize the intricate weave or texture.
sprinkled: a sprinkled texture is characterized by a light, airy appearance with small particles or irregular shapes scattered throughout.
sprinkled material has tiny particles dispersed throughout.
bubbly: bubbly material typically has a clear liquid with small, floating particles suspended in it.
a bubbly surface would typically appear as a slight disturbance on the outer layer of a liquid, often caused by tiny air bubbles rising to the surface.
lined: a lined surface is usually made up of a line of marks on one side with no marks on the other side of a solid, flat piece of paper.
lineated material is sheets of paper or cardboard with straight or wavy lines drawn on them in ink.
veined: veined material appears as a patterned or streaked texture often found in rocks or soil with many thin lines or streaks running through it smoothly.
a veined surface is typically characterized by striations or lines that resemble veins on a leaf.
bumpy: a bumpy texture can be somewhat rough and uneven in appearance.
i think bumpy material looks like rocks or gravel in the road or sand on a beach.
paisley: paisley patterns are typically characterized by a symmetrical design featuring repeating motifs of flowers and leaves in a specific arrangement.
a paisley pattern has a loose and curved design with multiple radial stripes of contrasting colors or hues.
potholed: potholed material is often rough and uneven.
a potholed texture has irregularities in its surface often caused by erosion or wear away.
waffled: a waffled surface appears rough and irregular.
a waffled texture is characterized by small cracks and crevices in the surface of an object.
pitted: a pitted surface is a irregularly shaped area covered with many small deep grooves and cracks.
a pitted surface is a irregularly shaped area covered with many small deep grooves and cracks.
frilly: frilly fabric is usually made of soft and lightweight materials such as cotton or silk.
a frilly surface is a delicate and lacy appearance.
spiralled: a spiralled surface is a curved or twisted surface.
a spiralled texture is a spiral pattern that appears when layers of material are stacked in a way that creates a twisted shape.
knitted: a knitted surface typically appears soft and fuzzy to the touch, with a gentle texture that can be velvety smooth in some areas and slightly more rough or scratchy in others, often featuring a range of colors or patterns that can be both visually
knitted fabric is soft and fuzzy and has a gentle texture.
grooved: a grooved surface is characterized by a series of small raised lines or indentations that run along the edge of an object.
a grooved texture on an object usually has parallel grooves cut into the surface.
dotted: dotted lines are small short wavy horizontal lines that appear between paragraphs or when typing on computers and are often used to separate text.
dotted lines have short vertical or diagonal dots in a solid color usually on a page of writing or printing.
interlaced: interlaced material resembles a weaving of disparate threads.
a interlaced surface is a pattern of interconnected fibers or threads that appear to be woven together.
crosshatched: crosshatched material is characterized by a pattern of intersecting lines in different colors or shades creating a mottled or flecked appearance.
a crosshatched texture is characterized by lines and points alternating in a checkered pattern across a surface.
wrinkled: a wrinkled surface can be seen as a surface that is creased or torn and has lost its smooth texture.
wrinkled material resembles a mixture of loose threads and creased fabric in general.
smeared: smeared material appears as a thin and blurry discoloration on surfaces when it is applied in excess.
a smeared texture is often described as having a vague, uneven, or blurred appearance.
striped: striped material often appears as horizontal or vertical bands of color in various patterns of solid or textured backgrounds.
a striped surface is usually created with horizontal and vertical patterns of colors like navy blue, red, white, and green on a white or light-colored background.
braided: braided material is typically made from strands of yarn or thread twisted together.
a braided surface is typically created by layering three or more pieces of fabric together in a specific pattern.
freckled: a freckled surface is typically uneven and patchy with small raised dots scattered randomly across the skin.
a freckled texture is often rough and uneven with a mix of fine and coarse scales.
cobwebbed: cobwebbed material appears as tangled threads.
cobwebbed material appears to be a collection of dry, fragile threads that are brittle and transparent and often stained with yellow or brown colors.
honeycombed: a honeycombed surface is characterized by many small holes or cavities that are typically uniform in size and distribution within the surface.
a honeycombed surface has small holes throughout like a matted grassy field.
woven: woven fabric appears as a complex pattern of threads.
a woven surface is typically a three dimensional object that consists of multiple layers of interwoven threads or fibers that are cut and knitted together.
matted: matte materials are typically smooth and unblemished often found on fabrics or surfaces such as stone or wood.
a matted texture appears to be a collection of closely entwined and knotted strands or fibers that give the appearance of being pulled or tangled together.
zigzagged: zigzagged material usually appears as wavy lines or patterns on certain types of paper products.
zigzagged material is often ribbed or bumpy.
marbled: marbled material is typically characterized by its speckled or flecked appearance that resembles a mix of colors in a visually interesting way.
marbled texture appears as a pattern of streaks and patches of different colors and shades that are woven together in a way that creates a visually interesting and dynamic effect.
studded: a studded texture resembles a combination of small bumps and raised patterns on a surface.
a studded texture is often characterized by small holes or inclusions created by the addition of a substance like metal, typically during the manufacturing process of the material.
grid: a grid texture is made up of horizontal and vertical lines that repeat over an area it appears as a repeating pattern of small squares with no gaps in between these squares can vary in size and spacing but are typically uniform.

a grid surface consists of a pattern of lines and squares that are arranged in a specific design and are typically found on floors, walls, and other horizontal surfaces to divide the space into smaller areas and provide stability.
